meanings.definition: To take great pleasure or delight in something.
meanings.sent1: The children revelled in the colorful fireworks display.
meanings.sent2: She revelled in the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The puppy revelled in chasing its tail around the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her heart revelled in the warmth of his kind words.
meanings.sent5: The artist's soul revelled in the freedom of creativity.

meanings.definition: To engage in lively and noisy festivities or celebrations.
meanings.sent1: The crowd revelled in the music at the concert.
meanings.sent2: They revelled in dancing and singing at the wedding.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys revelled in swinging from tree to tree in the jungle.
meanings.sent4: The city revelled in the excitement of the annual parade.
meanings.sent5: The students revelled in the energy of the school pep rally.
